AppDB.Name: ESEM_OUT_PP_PORT_BASED_ENCAP
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup {Out-PP-Port (8b)} in ESEM (up to 2 accesses). Possible results are L2 and L3 encapsulation instructions (up to to entries). OUT_PP_PORT-based encapsulation, used in RAW processing (optionally), PPH is ignored

Field.Description: One entry that holds both ARP (NextHop Eth) and AC (VLAN Manipulation) Up to 1 VLAN-Tag. Sized to fit ESEM (90b). Useful for Out-PP-Port-based L2 encapsulation.
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: ESEM Optimized (use as ESEM default)

Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: ESEM_TUNNEL_SVTAG

AppDB.Name: PON_UNMATCHED_CLASSIFICATION

AppDB.Name: PON_UNTAGGED_CLASSIFICATION
AppDB.OneLineDescription: PON Classification DB for untagged packets

AppDB.Name: RCH_TERM_BFIR_2ND_PASS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: In BIER_MPLS: the result is a BIER-LIF (P2P, representing MC-ID destination) In BIER_TI: the result is a BIER-LIF (P2MP, representing BIER domain). Used in BFIR flows, to terminate the RCH in 2nd pass into a BIER InLIF

AppDB.Name: BIER_BFER_TERMINATION
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup {FoDo(10b),SubDomain (10b), BFIR-ID(16b), Next-Protocol(8b)} in ISEM in the 2nd pass in a BFER termination flow. Next-Protocol, BIER SubDomain, and BFIR-ID are taken from BIER header. FoDo is the BIER Domain, it is taken from RCH. In both cases, the result is the BIER-LIF which may contain the next level FoDo for IPv4/IPv6/MPLS forwarding lookup, Learn-Information, and Statistics Object.. Lookup Forwarding Domain, SubDomain, BFIR-ID, and Next-Protocol to resolve LIF

AppDB.Name: FCOE_FCF_FODO
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup key may be VFT, VSI, or In-PP-Port . Forward-Domain Resolution for FCoE

AppDB.Name: INNER_ETHERNET_VLAN_CLASSIFICATION_LIF_SCOPED_VLAN_0_VLANS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Used for L2-Tunnels without service delimiting tags, with "Per tunnel" IVE

AppDB.Name: INNER_ETHERNET_VLAN_CLASSIFICATION_LIF_SCOPED_VLAN_1_VLANS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Inner_Ethernet_VLAN_Classification doesn't differentiate between VLAN "Types" (C/S etc...). Used for L2-Tunnels with 1 service delimiting tags

AppDB.Name: INNER_ETHERNET_VLAN_CLASSIFICATION_LIF_SCOPED_VLAN_2_VLANS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Inner_Ethernet_VLAN_Classification doesn't differentiate between VLAN "Types" (C/S etc...). Used for L2-Tunnels with 2 service delimiting tags

AppDB.Name: INNER_ETHERNET_VLAN_CLASSIFICATION_NETWORK_SCOPED_VLAN_0_VLANS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Used for L2-Tunnels without service delimiting tags, without Per-tunnel IVE

AppDB.Name: INNER_ETHERNET_VLAN_CLASSIFICATION_NETWORK_SCOPED_VLAN_1_VLANS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Inner_Ethernet_VLAN_Classification doesn't differentiate between VLAN "Types" (C/S etc...). Used for L2-Tunnels with 1 service delimiting tags

AppDB.Name: INNER_ETHERNET_VLAN_CLASSIFICATION_NETWORK_SCOPED_VLAN_2_VLANS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Inner_Ethernet_VLAN_Classification doesn't differentiate between VLAN "Types" (C/S etc...). Used for L2-Tunnels with 2 service delimiting tags

AppDB.Name: IPV4_TT_MP_EM_2ND_PASS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: 2nd Pass, Typically multicast bud node Drop_n_Continue

AppDB.Name: IPV4_TT_MP_EM_BASIC
AppDB.OneLineDescription: IPv4 {VRF,DIP,Additional_Header type} to LIF

AppDB.Name: IPV4_TT_P2P_EM_2ND_PASS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: 2nd Pass, Typically multicast bud node Drop_n_Continue

AppDB.Name: IPV4_TT_P2P_EM_BASIC
AppDB.OneLineDescription: IPv4 {VRF,SIP,DIP,Additional_Header type} to LIF

AppDB.Name: IPV6_TT_P2P_EM_BASIC
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup IPV6_ADDRESS_MSBS_ID, IPv6_Address[47:0], DIP_IDX . Combining results of IPv6 Tunnel Termination

AppDB.Name: IPV6_TT_SIP_MSB_COMPRESS_EM
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Compress IPv6 address MSBs to Index

AppDB.Name: ISID_WITHOUT_DOMAIN_EM
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Map {ISID} to ISID LIF

AppDB.Name: ISID_WITHOUT_DOMAIN_LEAF_NODE_EM
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Map {ISID} to ISID LIF (done at MC 1st pass, will hit for leaf node only)

AppDB.Name: ISID_WITH_DOMAIN_EM
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Map {B-SA,ISID} to ISID LIF

AppDB.Name: ISID_WITH_DOMAIN_LEAF_NODE_EM
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Map {B-SA,ISID} to ISID LIF (done at MC 1st pass, will hit for leaf node only)

AppDB.Name: L2TPV2_DATA_MESSAGE_TT
AppDB.OneLineDescription: {Next_Layer_Network_Domain(11), TUNNEL_ID(16) SESSION_ID(16)} key fits in 60b ISEM2 entry (AppDB(6)+Key(43)+Payload(20) = 69). L2TPv2 (RFC2661) Tunnel Termination

AppDB.Name: L2TPV3_DATA_MESSAGE_TT
AppDB.OneLineDescription: {Next_Layer_Network_Domain(11), SESSION_ID(32)} key fits in 60b ISEM2 entry (AppDB(6)+Key(43)+Payload(20) = 69). L2TPv3 (RFC3931) Tunnel Termination

AppDB.Name: LIF_SPOOFING_CHECK
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup {In_LIF[1](22), In_LIF[0](22)}. Check that an In_LIF arrived on an allowed In_LIF

AppDB.Name: MAC_ADDRESS_COMPRESSION_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: MAC_ADDRESS Compression MAC(48) => Compressed_MAC(16), currently used in PPPoE to compress MAC Address Prior to PPPoE tunnel termination lookup. MAC(48) Compression to Compressed_MAC(16)

AppDB.Name: MIM_TUNNEL_EM
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Map {Port,B-VID,B-SA} to MIM Tunnel LIF

AppDB.Name: MPLS_TERMINATION_CONTEXT_SPECIFIC_LABEL_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: The context for the label lookup is given by the "Extended-FoDO" (24b) which is either the In-LIF or another label (in case of upstream assignment). MPLS Context-Specific label mapping to LIF DB

AppDB.Name: MPLS_TERMINATION_CONTEXT_SPECIFIC_LABEL_DB_2ND_PASS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: 2nd Pass, Typically multicast bud node Drop_n_Continue The context for the label lookup is given by the "Extended-FoDO" (24b) which is either: The In-LIF or Another label (in case of upstream assignment). MPLS Context-Specific label mapping to LIF DB

AppDB.Name: MPLS_TERMINATION_SINGLE_LABEL_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: MPLS label mapping to LIF DB

AppDB.Name: MPLS_TERMINATION_SINGLE_LABEL_DB_2ND_PASS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: 2nd Pass, Typically multicast bud node Drop_n_Continue. MPLS label mapping to LIF DB

AppDB.Name: MPLS_TERMINATION_SINGLE_LABEL_WITH_BOS_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: MPLS label + BOS bit mapping to LIF DB (Used in EVPN multicast label termination)

AppDB.Name: PPPOE_O_ETH_TUNNEL_CMPRS_SA
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Optimized for PPPoE servers working at "Many Hosts : Few PPPoE clients : One PPPoE Server" {COMPRESSED_MAC_ID(16)(SA), SESSION_ID(16)} ey fits in 60b ISEM2 entry (AppDB(6)+Key(32)+Payload(20) = 58). PPPoE tunnel termination

AppDB.Name: PPPOE_O_ETH_TUNNEL_FULL_SA
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Optimized for PPPoE servers working at "Host==PPPoE Client : One PPPoE Server": {MAC_ADDRESS(48)(SA), SESSION_ID(16)} key Fits in 120b ISEM2 entry (AppDB(6)+Key(64)+Payload(20) = 90). PPPoE tunnel termination

AppDB.Name: SRV6_TERMINATED_LIF
AppDB.OneLineDescription: The native header is not exposed after the termination process, since the SRv6 header is too deep. Device need to map the SRH-Base.Next-Protocol into relevant next-protocol. Next protocol resides in the EEDB, here we find the OutLIF points to it. SRv6 Terminated flow mapping into OutLIF/RCH

AppDB.Name: TNI2VRF
AppDB.OneLineDescription: NVGRE TNI translation to VRF

AppDB.Name: TNI2VSI
AppDB.OneLineDescription: NVGRE TNI translation to VSI Forwarding-Domain

AppDB.Name: VNI2VRF
AppDB.OneLineDescription: VxLAN-GPE VNI translation to VRF

AppDB.Name: VNI2VSI
AppDB.OneLineDescription: VxLAN-GPE VNI translation to VSI

AppDB.Name: ING_VSI_INFO_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Contains all parameters relevant to VSI at the ingress. Note that the VSI may also be used as a RIF (in case of Ethernet termination), and thus some of the parameters here are relevant for the RIF as well. The index to this database is 18b since it is derived from the Forwarding-Domain. In practice, only the 17 lsbs are used. . Ingress VSI Database

Field.Description: Basic format, Default destination is MC_ID; VRID (JR compatible) supported; Statistics not supported
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: Basic format, Default destination is FEC, System-Port or Trap ID; VRID (JR compatible) supported; Statistics not supported
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: Basic format, Default destination can be any format; VRID (JR compatible) not supported; Statistics supported
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.OneLineDescription: {VRF,IPv6 in KAPS} when VRF equal zero; it acts at the Public Unicast AppDB .

AppDB.Name: BIER_TI_FORWARD
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup {Forward-Domain (10b), BIER-Sub-Domain(10b), BIER-SI(10b), BIER-BitStringLength(4b)}, taken from BIER header, in LEM. The result is the BIER Forwarding Table (BIFT) base address, which is encoded as the MC-ID in the Destination field . Lookup BIER header parameters in LEM to resolve Destination (BIFT-Base-Address)

AppDB.Name: BRIDGE_IPV4_MULTICAST_IVL
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup {VID, VSI, G(28)} in the LEM .

AppDB.Name: BRIDGE_IPV4_MULTICAST_SVL
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup {VSI, G(28)} in the LEM .

AppDB.OneLineDescription: {VRF,FC_D_ID} in LEM .

AppDB.OneLineDescription: {VRF,FC_S_ID} in LEM .

AppDB.Name: FCOE_TRANSIT_EM_ADMISSION_TEST
AppDB.OneLineDescription: {VRF, FC_S_ID} in LEM .

AppDB.Name: FWD_MACT
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup {VSI, MAC Address} in the MACT to detrmine the destination interface ot interface group .

Field.Description: There is currently no requirement for this entry. This entry should not be implemented until (i.e. no APIs), until proven needed. Possible use-case: MAC-Table result with 2 pointer is logically interesting only for an entry inserted and managed by the Host-CPU, where the Host-CPU is statically load-balancing a L2-Tunnel over 2 underlying tunnels For example PWE1 where some of the MACs (decided by CPU) go through PWE1->Tunnel5 and some of the MACs go through PWE1->Tunnel6
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: FWD_MACT_IVL
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup {VID, VSI, MAC} Address in the MACT to detrmine the destination interface ot interface group .

Field.Description: There is currently no requirement for this entry. This entry should not be implemented until (i.e. no APIs), until proven needed. Possible use-case: MAC-Table result with 2 pointer is logically interesting only for an entry inserted and managed by the Host-CPU, where the Host-CPU is statically load-balancing a L2-Tunnel over 2 underlying tunnels For example PWE1 where some of the MACs (decided by CPU) go through PWE1->Tunnel5 and some of the MACs go through PWE1->Tunnel6
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.OneLineDescription: {VRF,G,InLif0} in LEM .

AppDB.OneLineDescription: {VRF,IPv6} in LEM .

AppDB.Name: MAC_IN_MAC_LEARN_INFO
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Lookup {In-PP-Port, B-VLAN, B-SA} in the LEM to get the MIM tunnel learn information.

AppDB.Name: MPLS_FWD
AppDB.OneLineDescription: MPLS ILM table, for MPLS labels which are per Platform assigned .

AppDB.Name: MPLS_FWD_PER_IF_UA
AppDB.OneLineDescription: MPLS ILM table, for MPLS labels which per I/F of Upstream assigned .

AppDB.Name: LEXEM_TEST
AppDB.OneLineDescription: testing for Lexem

AppDB.Name: IN_AC_INFO_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: In-AC-1 contains In-LIFs of type AC of the outer Ethernet. In-AC (LIF) database connected to VTT1

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Jericho compatibility (W EEI) 4. No learning (WO VSI WO LEARN_EN) 5. 1xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. No Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Cannot be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (WO PROTECTION_PATH WO Protection_PTR)\ 8. No PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0) 9. QoS_Profile 6bits
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to a protected destination (W/O GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. No learning (WO VSI WO LEARN_EN) 5. 2xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. No Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Cannot be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (WO PROTECTION_PATH WO Protection_PTR)\ 8. No PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0) 9. QoS_Profile 6b
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to an unprotected destination (W GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. No learning (WO VSI WO LEARN_EN), LIF is unprotected (LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT = LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT_SYMMETRIC_LIF_OPTIMIZED) 5. 2xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. With Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Can be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (W PROTECTION_PATH W Protection_PTR) 8. W PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to an unprotected destination (W GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. No learning (WO VSI WO LEARN_EN), LIF is unprotected (LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT = LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT_SYMMETRIC_LIF_OPTIMIZED) 5. 2xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. With Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Cannot be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (NO PROTECTION_PATH NO Protection_PTR) 8. W large PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0+1)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to an unprotected destination (W GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. No learning (WO VSI WO LEARN_EN) 5. 1xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. No Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Cannot be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (WO PROTECTION_PATH WO Protection_PTR)\ 8. No PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0) 9. QoS_Profile 6bits
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to an unprotected destination (W GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. Supports learning (W VSI W LEARN_EN), LIF is unprotected (LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT = LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT_SYMMETRIC_LIF_OPTIMIZED) 5. 2xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1, VLAN_EDIT_VID_2) 6. Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Cannot be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (WO PROTECTION_PATH WO Protection_PTR) 8. W PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to an unprotected destination (W GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. Supports learning (W VSI W LEARN_EN), LIF is unprotected (LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT = LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT_SYMMETRIC_LIF_OPTIMIZED) 5. 1xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. can be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (W PROTECTION_PATH W Protection_PTR) 8. W PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: IN_LIF_FORMAT_DROPPED_COPY
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Contains In-LIFs of genral typs (not ACs) . In-LIFs (non ACs) database connected to VTT1

AppDB.Name: ETM_PP_DESCRIPTOR_EXPANSION
AppDB.OneLineDescription: ERPP only expands PP-CUD-MC Pointer, . Expanding PP-CUD-MC Pointer and PP-CUD-ACL Pointer

Field.Description: Indicating free space
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: OAMP_LM_SESSION_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Accessed from the OAMP in order to retrieve the updated OAM ID if doing LM/DM with multiple priority levels or SLM for a MP service or with multiple test IDs

AppDB.Name: OAMP_RMEP_INDEX_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Accessed from the OAMP in order to retrieve the index into the RMEP DB

AppDB.Name: OAMP_RMEP_STATIC_DATA_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Accessed from the OAMP in order to retrieve RMEP static data

AppDB.Name: EXEM_PER_PORT_IGNORE_MAC
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Per-port App DB for terminating all MACs according to next protocol

AppDB.Name: EXEM_PER_PORT_MY_MAC
AppDB.OneLineDescription: My-MAC App DB per port

AppDB.Name: EXEM_PER_VSI_MULTIPLE_MY_MAC_DA_MSB_0
AppDB.OneLineDescription: My-MAC App DB per VSI (may support multiple addresses per VSI)

AppDB.Name: EXEM_PER_VSI_MULTIPLE_MY_MAC_DA_MSB_1
AppDB.OneLineDescription: My-MAC App DB per VSI (may support multiple addresses per VSI)

AppDB.Name: EXEM_VRID_MY_MAC_WITH_PROTOCOL
AppDB.OneLineDescription: My-MAC App DB for VRID with next protocol

AppDB.Name: IN_AC_TCAM_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Ingress AC {VD,TPID_INDEX_1,VLAN_1,PCP_1,TPID_INDEX_2,VLAN_2,PCP_2,NEXT_PROTOCOL} TCAM mapping to LIF DB

AppDB.Name: IPV4_MULTICAST_TCAM_FORWARD
AppDB.OneLineDescription: {VRF,G,S,InLif0} in TCAM .

AppDB.Name: IPV4_TT_TCAM_2ND_PASS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: 2nd Pass, Typically multicast bud node Drop_n_Continue

AppDB.Name: IPV4_TT_TCAM_BASIC
AppDB.OneLineDescription: IPv4 Tunnel Termination TCAM Key:{VRF, DIP, SIP, IPv4_Additional_Header, Next_Layer_Type}

AppDB.Name: IPV4_VRF_DB_TCAM
AppDB.OneLineDescription: {IPV4 "ACL" in TCAM with result New-VRF} .

AppDB.Name: IPV6_MP_TT_TCAM_2ND_PASS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: DIP-IDX-Type(4):0x0: Intermediate-Result: DIP hit is insufficient for IPv6 tunnel-termination (SIP is mandatory) 0x1: LIF-Eligible: DIP hit is sufficient for IPv6 tunnel-termination (SIP is not mandatory). Lookup the {VRF,IPv6.DIP,1st-Additional-Header,2nd-Additional-Header} in a TCAM DB Result is DIP-IDX-Type(4), DIP-IDX-Data(20)

AppDB.Name: IPV6_MP_TT_TCAM_BASIC
AppDB.OneLineDescription: DIP-IDX-Type(4):0x0: Intermediate-Result: DIP hit is insufficient for IPv6 tunnel-termination (SIP is mandatory) 0x1: LIF-Eligible: DIP hit is sufficient for IPv6 tunnel-termination (SIP is not mandatory). Lookup the {VRF,IPv6.DIP,1st-Additional-Header,2nd-Additional-Header} in a TCAM DB Result is DIP-IDX-Type(4), DIP-IDX-Data(20)

AppDB.Name: IPV6_VRF_DB_TCAM
AppDB.OneLineDescription: IPV6 ACL in TCAM with result New-VRF. SIP is taken 96msb - in order to fit into less than 320n entry. .

AppDB.Name: MPLS_FRR_TCAM_DB
AppDB.OneLineDescription: FRR optimization termination DB (in TCAM)

AppDB.Name: INNER_ETH_VLAN_EDIT_CLASSIFICATION
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Indexed WO Protection indirection, WO Learning
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: INNER_ETH_VLAN_EDIT_CLASSIFICATION_VLAN_EDIT
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Un_Indexed VLAN_EDIT, Example: PWE raw mode or PWE tagged-mode without Service-delimiting tags
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: Un_Indexed VLAN_EDIT and VSI Classification, Example: PWE tagged-mode with Service-delimiting tags
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: PON_DTC_CLASSIFICATION
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Jericho compatibility (W EEI) 4. No learning (WO VSI WO LEARN_EN) 5. 1xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. No Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Cannot be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (WO PROTECTION_PATH WO Protection_PTR)\ 8. No PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0) 9. QoS_Profile 6bits
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to a protected destination (W/O GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. No learning (WO VSI WO LEARN_EN) 5. 2xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. No Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Cannot be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (WO PROTECTION_PATH WO Protection_PTR)\ 8. No PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0) 9. QoS_Profile 6b
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to an unprotected destination (W GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. No learning (WO VSI WO LEARN_EN), LIF is unprotected (LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT = LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT_SYMMETRIC_LIF_OPTIMIZED) 5. 2xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. With Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Can be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (W PROTECTION_PATH W Protection_PTR) 8. W PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to an unprotected destination (W GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. No learning (WO VSI WO LEARN_EN), LIF is unprotected (LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT = LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT_SYMMETRIC_LIF_OPTIMIZED) 5. 2xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. With Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Cannot be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (NO PROTECTION_PATH NO Protection_PTR) 8. W large PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0+1)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to an unprotected destination (W GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. No learning (WO VSI WO LEARN_EN) 5. 1xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. No Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Cannot be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (WO PROTECTION_PATH WO Protection_PTR)\ 8. No PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0) 9. QoS_Profile 6bits
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to an unprotected destination (W GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. Supports learning (W VSI W LEARN_EN), LIF is unprotected (LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT = LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT_SYMMETRIC_LIF_OPTIMIZED) 5. 2xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1, VLAN_EDIT_VID_2) 6. Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. Cannot be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (WO PROTECTION_PATH WO Protection_PTR) 8. W PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 1. Indexed LIF (W GLOBAL_IN_LIF) 2. P2P (W Destination) 3. Optimized for P2P to an unprotected destination (W GLOBAL_OUT_LIF_0) 4. Supports learning (W VSI W LEARN_EN), LIF is unprotected (LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT = LEARN_PAYLOAD_CONTEXT_SYMMETRIC_LIF_OPTIMIZED) 5. 1xVLAN_EDIT_VIDs (VLAN_EDIT_VID_1) 6. Counter/Meter: (INLIF_STAT_OBJ_ID, INLIF_STAT_OBJ_CMD) 7. can be used as 1+1 or Ring_Protection (W PROTECTION_PATH W Protection_PTR) 8. W PMF_GENERIC_DATA (LIF_GENERIC_DATA_0)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: IN_LIF_FORMAT_BIER
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

AppDB.Name: IN_LIF_FORMAT_LIF_SPOOFING_CHECK
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

AppDB.Name: IN_LIF_FORMAT_EVPN
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

AppDB.Name: IN_LIF_IPvX_TUNNELS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: IPv4/IPv6 Tunnel 180bit, (Right now smaller than 156 to allow room for future growth: protection pointer? Point to Point? PMF_Data?) MP (No "Destination"), Unprotected (No protection), L2(Learn_data 48+4bits, can learn anything) or L3 with Explicit Forward_Domain on packet (no FORWARD_DOMAIN), GRE8_W_Key_W_TNI(L2/L3)/VxLAN/VxLAN_GPE(L2/L3)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: IPv4/IPv6 Tunnel 120bit, (Right now smaller than 109 to allow room for future growth: PMF_Data?) MP (No "Destination"), Unprotected (No protection), L2(Learn_data 21+2bits, can learn FEC) or L3 with TNI/VNI on packet (no FORWARD_DOMAIN), GRE8_W_Key_W_TNI(L2/L3)/VxLAN/VxLAN_GPE(L2/L3)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: IPv4/IPv6 Tunnel 120b, (Right now smaller than 104 to allow room for future growth: PMF_Data?) MP (No "Destination"), Unprotected (No protection), L3 without TNI/VNI on packet (Has FORWARD_DOMAIN, Forward Domain Must be VRF), GRE4/GRE8_W_Key_WO_TNI(L3)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: IN_LIF_FORMAT_MIM
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

AppDB.Name: IN_LIF_FORMAT_LSP
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

AppDB.Name: IN_LIF_FORMAT_DUMMY_MPLS
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: InLIF without Global LIF; I.e., will not be added to InLIF stack. LIF has no information; it should not terminate any labels
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: IN_LIF_PSEUDO_FOR_VALIDATION
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: InLIF without Global LIF; I.e., will not be added to InLIF stack. LIF has no information; it's all importance is it's existence in the AppDB
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

AppDB.Name: IN_LIF_FORMAT_SRV6_TERMINATED
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE
RESULT_TYPE
RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_OUT_AC
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: 60bit AC Entry Inner/Outer 2 VLANs: ENCAP_DESTINATION(24)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 2 VLAN_TAGs + 3rd Tag: 3rd Tag can be E_TAG or PON_TAG
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_BIER
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: BIER BitString information to be used in BIER-BFIR flow, where BitSringLength==64b
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: BIER-MPLS Header construction information to be used in BIER-BFIR flow
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_RIF_BASIC
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Optimized Entry (30 bit) (1) Up to 32K Eth-RIFs (2) Supports 4 MTU Profiles (3) ACTION_PROFILE(1) (DROP/PASS) (4) No Counter
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: (1) Up to 128K Eth-RIFs (2) Supports 4 MTU Profiles (3) ACTION_PROFILE(2) (typical) (4) LIF_STAT_OBJ_ID(14)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_IPFIX_PSAMP
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Entry including IPFIX and PSAMP information: IPFIX.Observation-Domain(32), and PSAMP.Template-ID(16) IPFIX header is over UDP, and PSAMP is IPFIX extension, over IPFIX. Normally this entry is pointed by OutLIF from ingress at packet sampling.
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_L2TP
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Builds PPPoL2TPv2/L2TPv2 tunnel
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_MPLS_TUNNEL
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: This entry can be used for Application Labels [L3VPN,PWE] and Tunnels [BGP, RSVP_TE] under the following assumptions: 1. No Counter/Meter 2. No Protection 3. When used as PWE: A. No LLVP_Profile, uses LLVP_Profile 0x0 (missing ESEM_NAME_SPACE LLVP_Profile is ESEM_NAME_SPACE[11:9]) 4. When used in TTL_MODEL "Pipe" TTL is limited to 1 of 8 values (TTL_IDX (3bit)) 5. When used in QoS_MODEL "Pipe" NWK_QoS is limited to 1 of 32 values (NWK_QOS_IDX (5bit)) 6. No Next_Pointer
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: JR2-A0 WA; should be deleted in B0 Also used for PWEs
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: This entry can be installed on the EEDB or generated by EEI2ETPS fixed logic. The field ordering in this entry is MANDATORY in order to support the EEI2EES fixed logic. The size of the entry (120) is MANDATORY in order to support the EEI2EES fixed logic. EEI_MPLS_Push_Type(6) = EEI_Mpls_push_2_EES_map[EEI_Type[2:0]].ees_type EEI_MPLS_Push_Data(94) = EEI_Mpls_push_2_EES_map[EEI_Type[2:0]].ees_data EEI2EES fixed logic construct the following entry:{EEI_MPLS_Push_Type(6),EEI_Label(20),EEI_MPLS_Push_Data(94),10'b0}
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: This entry can be used for SR under the following assumptions: 1. No Counter/Meter 2. No Protection 3. No OAM 4. No Additional_Header 5. TTL Uniform Model 6. QoS Uniform Model
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: JR2-A0 WA; should be deleted in B0 Should not be used for PWEs (missing LLVP profile (ESEM_NAME_SPACE MSBs)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: JR2-A0 WA; should be deleted in B0 Should not be used for PWEs (missing LLVP profile (ESEM_NAME_SPACE MSBs)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: JR2-A0 WA; should be deleted in B0 Should not be used for PWEs (missing LLVP profile (ESEM_NAME_SPACE MSBs)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: 3. No LLVP_Profile, uses LLVP_Profile 0x0 (missing ESEM_NAME_SPACE LLVP_Profile is ESEM_NAME_SPACE[11:9]) 4. No ESEM_Command 7. No OutLIF Profile (OAM LM single priority)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_PWE
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: This entry can be used for Application Labels [L3VPN,PWE] and Tunnels [BGP, RSVP_TE] under the following assumptions: 1. No Counter/Meter 2. No Protection 3. When used as PWE: A. No LLVP_Profile, uses LLVP_Profile 0x0 (missing ESEM_NAME_SPACE LLVP_Profile is ESEM_NAME_SPACE[11:9]) 4. When used in TTL_MODEL "Pipe" TTL is limited to 1 of 8 values (TTL_IDX (3bit)) 5. When used in QoS_MODEL "Pipe" NWK_QoS is limited to 1 of 32 values (NWK_QOS_IDX (5bit)) 6. No Next_Pointer
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: JR2-A0 WA; should be deleted in B0 Also used for PWEs
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: This entry can be installed on the EEDB or generated by EEI2ETPS fixed logic. The field ordering in this entry is MANDATORY in order to support the EEI2EES fixed logic. The size of the entry (120) is MANDATORY in order to support the EEI2EES fixed logic. EEI_MPLS_Push_Type(6) = EEI_Mpls_push_2_EES_map[EEI_Type[2:0]].ees_type EEI_MPLS_Push_Data(94) = EEI_Mpls_push_2_EES_map[EEI_Type[2:0]].ees_data EEI2EES fixed logic construct the following entry:{EEI_MPLS_Push_Type(6),EEI_Label(20),EEI_MPLS_Push_Data(94),10'b0}
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_EVPN
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: This entry can be used for Application Labels [L3VPN,PWE] and Tunnels [BGP, RSVP_TE] under the following assumptions: 1. No Counter/Meter 2. No Protection 3. When used as PWE: A. No LLVP_Profile, uses LLVP_Profile 0x0 (missing ESEM_NAME_SPACE LLVP_Profile is ESEM_NAME_SPACE[11:9]) 4. When used in TTL_MODEL "Pipe" TTL is limited to 1 of 8 values (TTL_IDX (3bit)) 5. When used in QoS_MODEL "Pipe" NWK_QoS is limited to 1 of 32 values (NWK_QOS_IDX (5bit)) 6. No Next_Pointer
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: JR2-A0 WA; should be deleted in B0 Also used for PWEs
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: This entry can be installed on the EEDB or generated by EEI2ETPS fixed logic. The field ordering in this entry is MANDATORY in order to support the EEI2EES fixed logic. The size of the entry (120) is MANDATORY in order to support the EEI2EES fixed logic. EEI_MPLS_Push_Type(6) = EEI_Mpls_push_2_EES_map[EEI_Type[2:0]].ees_type EEI_MPLS_Push_Data(94) = EEI_Mpls_push_2_EES_map[EEI_Type[2:0]].ees_data EEI2EES fixed logic construct the following entry:{EEI_MPLS_Push_Type(6),EEI_Label(20),EEI_MPLS_Push_Data(94),10'b0}
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_NULL
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Indicating non-existing entry; not to be added into EEDB/ESEM
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_PPPOE
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Builds PPPoPPPoE/PPPoE tunnel
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_RSPAN
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Used in RSPAN to trigger {SOURCE_SYSTEM_PORT_AGGREGATE, ESEM_NAME_SPACE} lookup
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_SFLOW
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: sFlow Extended Gateway data sampling - first pass
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: sFlow Extanded Gateway data sampling - second pass
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: sFlow Header sampling in data plane
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: sFlow Header sampling and aggregate in eventor
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_SRV6
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Pointed from an OutLIF, holds the number of segments, SRH-base info, and EEDB pointer to the next SID
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_ARP
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Optimized Entry (60 bit) This entry is typically used by "The last Router" before a large bridging domain containing many hosts This Entry must be preceded in the ETPS stack by a RIF entry This Entry should be succeed in the ETPS stack by an AC Entry, The AC_Entry should have (at least) the following attributes: MTU_Profile
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: One entry that holds both ARP (NextHop Eth) and AC (VLAN Manipulation) Useful between directly attached routers
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: One entry that holds both ARP (NextHop Eth) and AC (VLAN Manipulation) Up to 1 VLAN-Tag STATISTICs Useful between directly attached routers
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: ARP Entry used typically for tunneling SA calculated according to VSI This Entry should be succeed in the ETPS stack by an AC Entry, The AC_Entry should have (at least) the following attributes: MTU_Profile TODO: The fact this entry has MTU_PROFILE is a bug
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: ARP with counter and "Custom SA", support LIF_STAT_OBJ_ID under 64K only This Entry should be succeed in the ETPS stack by an AC Entry, The AC_Entry should have (at least) the following attributes: MTU_Profile TODO: The fact this entry has MTU_PROFILE is a bug
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_REFLECTOR
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Basic L2/L3 Reflector. ETPP-FWD Context chosen from TYPE. Swap and TTL stamp done by BC. No additional attributes
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: L2 Multicast Reflector. ETPP-FWD Context chosen from TYPE. PEMA overwrites MC-DA with ETPS[TOS][47:00]; Swap and TTL stamp done by BC.
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_OAM_REFLECTOR
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: OAM L2 Reflector. ETPP-FWD Context chosen from TYPE. Swap and OAM-op-code stamp done by BC. No additional attributes
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_TWAMP
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Raw-Data encodes Termination Depth and Error Estimate for TWAMP-Reflector swap operation. Copied by PEMA to Candidate Header.
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_IPV4_TUNNEL
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Data entry including the source IP for injected BFD packets - used to support more than 256 source IPs. Should point to an ARP entry (OAMP points to this entry instead of pointing to the ARP entry)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: RAW_IPv4 tunnel
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: IPv4 GRE4 and GRE8 various flavors
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: VxLAN/VxLAN_GPE (According to LIF_ADDITIONAL_HEADER_PROFILE)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

Field.Description: VxLAN/VxLAN_GPE (According to LIF_ADDITIONAL_HEADER_PROFILE)
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE

AppDB.Name: EEDB_ERSPAN
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

AppDB.Name: EEDB_IPV6_TUNNEL
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

AppDB.Name: EEDB_RCH
AppDB.OneLineDescription: Empty

Field.Description: Encodes information for the construction of Recycling Header (RCH). ETPP-ENC5 (PEMA) pops ETPS and copies RAW_DATA to UDH. ETPP-TRAP (PEMA) copies UDH, PPH, and FTMH containers into RCH
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE
